Posts.Content: Oct 16, 2010 02:25PM HappyGirl45 wrote: Hi All, Surgery went well Wednesday.  Stayed over night and was released late Thursday.  Had the patch behind my ear for nausea but still got sick with nausea.  Have not been able to sleep very well.  Everyone is right ... recliner is the best place for rest.  Yesterday I was very sore...I think it was more the muscles I have to use now to move around.  Thinking of all and wishing the best, Verna
Posts.Title: October 2010 Mastectomy cc4npg cc4npg

Posts.Content: Oct 19, 2010 03:21PM HappyGirl45 wrote: Eileen, I think you did the right thing!  Like you wrote you did what you could to prevent any future issues.  I say good for you!  And you are allowed to have cranky times.  Yesterday was a busy day for you. I don't know about you but sometimes I get all good news and am still crying like a baby or am cranky.  It is ok.  My DH just doesn't understand when I am down at times.  Eileen you are allowed and a big hug to you from me.  We are going through so much...  Just want to let you know it is ok. Today I went to my PS...the drain didn't come out.  I didn't think it was.  I am still draining 25 cc in 2 hours.  The dressing were taken off.  The nipple looks good.  Hooray.  I didn't receive any instruction on stretching exercises either.  Today the PS told me to not push myself.  I will have good days and bad days.  Today I am very sore ... yesterday I was feeling better.    Hope all of you are having a good day!  You are all in my thoughts and prayers!
Posts.Title: October 2010 Mastectomy cc4npg cc4npg

Posts.Content: Oct 25, 2010 04:23AM HappyGirl45 wrote: myrrl, I am with you...really dislike expander.  I still have to sleep on many pillows sitting up.  It is getting better very slowly...instead of 5 pillows down to 4 now.  By afternoon still need to take pain meds; I really dislike taking meds.  I have read how some are able to go to work within couple of weeks.  There is no way I could. :(  I can barely ride in the car.  Opps, I am whining.  I will stop now.  Hope everyone is doing well.  You are each in my thoughts and prayers.

Posts.Content: Nov 14, 2010 07:29PM HappyGirl45 wrote: boatergrl,  Everyday gets better.  I am four and half weeks out and this past week was a big turning point concerning the fatigue/energy.  I don't get wiped out from doing small things like previously but everyone is different. After fills of my TE it seems to get better.  Of course the first day or so it was uncomfortable (not painful) due to the stretching of the muscle.  Again, it seemed this last week was a turning point for me, doing much better.  I can sleep better and the last couple of days have been able to side on my side. I am on the fast track to getting my exchange...that is this Friday for me.  I am better just in time for the next surgery!  Hope everyone is having a nice Sunday.  It is nice and sunny here in Maryland today.  Wishing everyone well!

Posts.Content: Nov 3, 2010 09:13AM HappyGirl45 wrote: Ladies, You all make me smile.    myrrl, Love the recliner story...that is exactly how I get the recliner folded out...cannot imagine my thoughts when you said don't do it...I was like what in the heck did I destroy in my body using it to open the recliner.  All my best for your outpatient surgery.    I had a fill yesterday...wow, am I sore.  Hard to sleep last night.  My DH said the doc just kept filling...  After all we have been through I feel bad even saying how sore/uncomfortable I am concerning the fill.  I am on the fast track for the exchange.  I am scheduled for November 19th.  Didn't want to miss any more work than necessary...    Hope we all have a great day!

Posts.Content: Oct 30, 2010 08:57PM HappyGirl45 wrote: Hi Eileen, I am still very sore, had my surgery 10/13.  I did have TE and was filled allot.  It hurts to even bend over still for me.  So don't be to hard on yourself.  I still sleep almost sitting up but am getting better.    My BS and PS both said there will be good and bad days, said the surgery was very invasive to the body and it will take time to heal.  I think on my good days I do to much.   My children are older (20 and 22), so none are trick or treating for them.  The big event is tomorrow evening in my area.  I live in the country so we don't get many Trick or Treaters (maybe 10 or so, but I bought enough candy for a small army. I am going to try to attend a bon fire this evening.  Should be fun...I will try to take a nap before hand.  It is with some of my DH's co-workers. It is getting chilly here at night...so I will have to get out some winter items to take such as gloves.   Woohoo, first late night out for me in awhile - we will see how long I make it...  :-)  Thing to add to the difficult list:  bending over to put on shoes!  Another suggest is to carry/have a pillow in the car for a bit after surgery.   Hopefully by Christmas we will have all our energy!  I think we will.  :-)  I agree with Janet...the ones with just one side done (I just had right side done) can compensate with the other side.  It is much harder when both sides are done.   Everyone is in my thoughts and wishing all a good recovery.
Posts.Title: October 2010 Mastectomy cc4npg cc4npg

Posts.Content: Dec 2, 2010 05:12PM HappyGirl45 wrote: Hi Janet,  PS "fills" tissue expander (temporary implant, which has port like device, where he/she adds the saline) with saline.  "Exchange" is surgery that PS takes out temp. implant (TE) replaces with permanent implant when skin and muscle is stretched to where needs to be.  I am sure some other ladies will add more.  myrrl,  it is amazing how many women are on the November and December threads...  My thoughts are with them all.  Hope everyone is having a good day.  Very cold here in Maryland today...at least the sun is out.  Yesterday we had a horrible stormy day.  The scar area and muscles of my mx was really sore yesterday.

Posts.Content: Oct 18, 2010 08:51AM HappyGirl45 wrote: Janet and Angelisa, The meds are really working here...  I missed your postings the other evening but looks like I answered you both.  As always thank you for your postings.  All is going well here.  Only a little swooshing going on now; at the top of breast.  Last night was the first night I didn't wake up every hour.  Only woke up once around 3:30 am.  Hooray!   The draining is still going strong.  I think the sorest part is where the drain is coming out of me.  But like everyone says it is no big deal just thankful it is there getting all that stuff out of me. I have an appointment with PS on Tuesday, I would be surprised at this point if he takes out the drain...especially if it is still draining like it is. Wednesday is appointment with BS to go over path report...keeping my fingers crossed.    All, Hope everyone is doing well and all are in my prayers!     Have a great day!

Posts.Content: Nov 12, 2010 05:16PM HappyGirl45 wrote: myrrl,  I was able to see my BS today.  He did a sonogram of the two little white hard bumps.  BS said this happens sometimes with TE.  Explained sometimes there isn't a channel to drain excess fluid between skin and TE.  Told me to call him Monday if the bumps get any larger.  The bumps aren't red or hot, and don't hurt. Sorry to hear you still have the fear...

Posts.Content: Sep 30, 2010 07:53AM HappyGirl45 wrote: I truly believe BC may be caused/induced by stress.   I had a job where my back between the shoulder blades stayed on fire most days.  I knew it was a really stressful day when my eye lid twitched.  About 3 months ago, I took steps to find a new job; hoping to reduce stress in my life. Shortly after starting new job (within two weeks) was diagnosed with BC.  Genetics test came back negative. I just want to thank all on this website.  It has been such a comfort to have words from others during this trying situation.
Posts.Title: Did stress cause my BC? chrissyc
